sentences.en: But given the electorate's penchant for ballot - box rebellions , all predictions at this stage look perilous.
sentences.cn: 但是考虑到选民们叛逆性会作用于大选, 目前所有的预测都是经不住考量的.

sentences.en: Despite her penchant for chitchat , Yvonne was no birdbrain, Martin discovered.
sentences.cn: 马丁发现, 尽管伊冯非常喜欢瞎聊,可她并不是没头脑.

sentences.en: He had a penchant for playing jokes on people.
He seems to have a penchant for my children.
sentences.cn: 他似乎很喜欢我的孩子们.

sentences.en: It was this performance, not his penchant for haiku poetry, that impressed other EU leaders.
sentences.cn: 正是这一表现(而非他对俳句的热爱), 给其他欧盟领导人留下了深刻印象.

sentences.en: Nor does the island's penchant for equality stop at work - sharing.
sentences.cn: 他岛对平等的倾向也未因共享而停止.

sentences.en: On the other hand, David also a penchant for bright pink nails.
sentences.cn: 另外, 贝克汉姆也对粉红色指甲情有独钟.

sentences.en: She has a penchant for champagne.
The Irish have a penchant for blarney.
sentences.cn: 爱尔兰人喜欢花言巧语.

sentences.en: There is also reason to think that our penchant for makingunhealthy choices might be enhanced by the abundance of particularfoods.
sentences.cn: 我们也有理由认为，我们做出不健康选择的倾向，也许被大量特定食物加强了。

sentences.en: They have an equal and opposite penchant for conspiracy theories.
sentences.cn: 他们对于阴谋论有着程度相当、倾向相反的喜好.

sentences.en: With a penchant for sliding tackle you can rouse your team mates and stir the crowd.
sentences.cn: 爱好飞铲使他能够唤醒队友并使观众沸腾.

trans.tran_en: if you have a penchant for something, you like that thing very much and try to do it or have it often
